attributes.action: submit all MPs to the same expense rules as all other employees, and thus expenses should be declared on a P11D and taxable.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
MPs are in a privileged position, they are placed they by the public and can be removed by the public. 

If I claim expenses my employer has to complete a P11D and I have to pay tax on any benefit that I obtain as that is considered remuneration for my work.

My employer can apply to HMRC for a P11D dispensation if he can demonstrate that there is no element of benefit in the expenses that he pays.

For example HMRC will not allow my employer to pay me £25 a night if, when away on business I stay with a friend or relative (or Jaqui Smith's sister) without taxing me on it because they maintain that there is benefit in it for me - even though I would of course take a gift or similar for my hosts.

I propose that MP's expenses should be subject to the same P11D regime as my employer and I are - and further that any benefit that MPs receive should be repaid to the State.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
